intro: Pausandra macrostachya, commonly known as the showy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, organic soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pausandra macrostachya is a member of the Polemoniacaceae family and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
